intro: Tithymalus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely hairy stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
